publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2889 Rhoda Grant: Screentime-That the Parliament congratulates the project director and trustees of Screentime on achieving charitable status for the organisation; supports their plans for providing people in the Highlands and Islands with access to film and media professionals, to new-media technology, to industry training workshops and to community and career development opportunities; welcomes the success of the two pilot programmes in 1999 and 2001; recognises the contribution that Screentime could make to the sustainable development of the region, and wishes it well in raising funds for the programme of events later this year.

S1M-2889 Rhoda Grant: Screentimeâ€”That the Parliament congratulates the project director and trustees of Screentime on achieving charitable status for the organisation; supports their plans for providing people in the Highlands and Islands with access to film and media professionals, to new-media technology, to industry training workshops and to community and career development opportunities; welcomes the success of the two pilot programmes in 1999 and 2001; recognises the contribution that Screentime could make to the sustainable development of the region, and wishes it well in raising funds for the programme of events later this year.
S1M-2889 Screentime (lodged on 12 March 2002) Maureen Macmillan*, Mary Scanlon*
S1M-2889 Screentime (lodged on 12 March 2002) Elaine Smith*
S1M-2889 Screentime (lodged on 12 March 2002) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2889 Screentime (lodged on 12 March 2002) Michael Russell*
